dismissalText.commentary: Shafiul Islam c Taylor b Guptill 11 (20b 2x4 0x6 22m) SR: 55

commentTextItems.html: Shafiul decides enough is enough and slog sweeps and gets a top edge and Taylor runs around to mid on to take the catch and New Zealand win by 146 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: A disappointing performance from the Bangladeshi's, backing up their poor performance in the T20I in Hamilton on Wednesday night.
Jacob Oram (83) and Neil Broom's (71) quickfire record partnership of 123 for the seventh wicket really set the game up for New Zealand after Ingram (69) and Taylor (51) gave their wickets away.
Shahadat and Naeem bowled well at times for Bangladesh but on the whole, their bowlers struggled for consistency.

Bangladesh's batting started with a hiss and a roar with Tamim and Imrul adding 71 for the first wicket, however that was the end of the fireworks and when Tamim fell for 62 with the score at 119, the chase was effectively over.
McKay (two for 40) was promising with the ball on debut but it was Vettori's guile which tore the heart out of the chase with three for 33 and Guptill mopped up the tail with two for seven.
Jacob Oram is named Man of the Match for a magnificent 83 off just 40 balls with eight fours and five sixes, as well as two for 33 off nine overs.

The focus now switches to Dunedin where the 2nd ODI takes place on Monday. Please join us again on Monday from 12pm NZDT or 2300 GMT (Sunday Feb 7). Thanks for joining me tonight. This is Marc Ellison signing off. Goodnight.

notes: 3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (PJ Ingram 25, LRPL Taylor 23, Ex 2)
Drinks: 83/2 in 16.0 overs (PJ Ingram 53, LRPL Taylor 25)
LRPL Taylor: 50 off 48 balls (4 x 4, 2 x 6)
Drinks: 182/5 in 34.0 overs (NT Broom 23, DL Vettori 30)
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 54 balls (NT Broom 19, DL Vettori 31, Ex 0)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 44 balls (NT Broom 25, JDP Oram 24, Ex 1)
JDP Oram: 50 off 28 balls (6 x 4, 2 x 6)
7th Wicket: 100 runs in 60 balls (NT Broom 40, JDP Oram 54, Ex 6)
1st Wicket:50 runs in 34 minutes.((Tamim Iqbal/Imrul Kayes).
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 45 balls (Tamim Iqbal 23, Imrul Kayes 23, Ex 6)

milestones.description: Jacob Oram and Neil Broom's 123-run partnership is NZ's highest for the 7th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 115 between Adam Parore and Lee Germon
This is the highest match aggregate (526) involving teams New Zealand & Bangladesh in ODIs

stories.title: We soaked up the pressure well - Greatbatch
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Napier
stories.seoTitle: We soaked up the pressure well - Mark Greatbatch
stories.summary: The New Zealand coach has praised the way his players overcame pressure situations to beat Bangladesh by 146 runs in the first one-day international in Napier

image.caption: Jacob Oram blasted a 40-ball 83
image.longCaption: Jacob Oram blasted a 40-ball 83, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Napier, February 5, 2010

stories.title: Oram onslaught knocks Bangladesh out
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Napier
stories.seoTitle: Jacob Oram onslaught knocks Bangladesh out
stories.summary: A fearsome assault from Jacob Oram, and his damaging partnership with Neil Broom, helped New Zealand crush Bangladesh by 146 runs in the first ODI in Napier

image.caption: Peter Ingram scored a half-century on debut
image.longCaption: Peter Ingram scored a half-century on debut, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Napier, February 5, 2010

stories.title: No way but up for Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Napier
stories.seoTitle: No way but up for Bangladesh in ODIs against New Zealand
stories.summary: Bangladesh have had a forgettable 2010 so far, and their record in New Zealand is also dreadful. This is their chance to change that
